vulnerabilities.description: XXE injection in xml2js parser used for HL7 message processing
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to xml2js 0.5.0 or later immediately

analysis.justification: xml2js is used to parse HL7 v2 messages from external EHR systems (Epic, Cerner). XXE allows reading patient database credentials and accessing arbitrary PHI.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). HL7 parser processes untrusted XML from external healthcare providers. XXE can expose entire patient database. HIPAA breach notification required if exploited. IMMEDIATE PATCHING REQUIRED.

vulnerabilities.description: Buffer overflow in Sharp image processing library

analysis.justification: Sharp is used to process DICOM medical images (X-rays, MRIs, CT scans). Buffer overflow allows RCE via malicious images uploaded by patients or providers.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Imaging service processes untrusted DICOM files. RCE could allow attacker to access all medical imaging and PHI. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.

vulnerabilities.description: FHIR client authentication token leakage vulnerability
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade to fhir-kit-client 2.0.0 or later immediately

analysis.justification: FHIR client is used to integrate with Epic and Cerner EHR systems. Token leakage allows unauthorized access to millions of patient records across connected hospitals.
analysis.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). EHR integration is core functionality. Token compromise = access to all connected EHR systems. Potential HIPAA breach affecting millions of patients. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED.

analysis.justification: simple-peer is used for telehealth video consultations. MITM attacks allow eavesdropping on confidential doctor-patient conversations.
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Telehealth is internet-facing. MITM could expose confidential medical discussions. HIPAA Privacy Rule violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

vulnerabilities.description: JWT signature verification bypass in jsonwebtoken

analysis.justification: JWT is used for patient portal authentication. Signature bypass allows attackers to forge tokens and access any patient's medical records.
analysis.detail: HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Patient portal is internet-facing. Token forgery = unauthorized PHI access. HIPAA Security Rule violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.

vulnerabilities.description: Command injection in lodash template function

analysis.justification: Lodash is used only for utility functions (cloneDeep, merge, etc.). Template function is never called with user input.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Code review confirms lodash.template is not used anywhere in codebase. Only safe utility functions are used. Upgrade planned for next maintenance window.

analysis.justification: Axios is only used for outbound requests to trusted EHR APIs. All URLs are whitelisted and not user-controllable.
analysis.detail: LOW PRIORITY: Prototype pollution requires user-controlled request config. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured EHR endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.
